title: I Am Artemis: Ethan Jacobs

title: New Citizen Science Proposals Funded in 2025
summary: NASA has selected 10 new citizen science proposals for funding in 2025. These selections provide a preview of what’s coming next for NASA citizen science. Note that these investigations are research grants: some of them will result in new opportunities for the public, while others will analyze or build on results from earlier citizen science projects.

title: NASA’s TESS Spacecraft Triples Size of Pleiades Star Cluster
summary: Astronomers have revolutionized our understanding of a collection of stars in the northern sky called the Pleiades. They used data from NASA’s TESS (Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite) and other observatories as NASA explores the secrets of the universe for the benefit of all, from the Moon to Mars and beyond. By examining the rotation, chemistry, […]

title: NASA Stennis Engineer Follows Family Footsteps into NASA’s Artemis Era
summary: Huy Nguyen grew up hearing about rocket engines and space flight around the family table. His parents worked for NASA’s Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans, and those early conversations eventually started his path to NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi. “They both created a household that allowed me to be curious […]

title: The ultimate backup: why humanity needs a lunar seed vault — now
summary:
Humanity is losing the genetic diversity that sustains life on Earth at a pace that should alarm every nation. According to the UN Food and Agriculture Organization, about 75% of the world’s crop varieties have disappeared in the last century. According to Marie Haga, former Executive Director of the Global Crop Trust, it’s closer to […]

title: The Exploration Company Acquires German Additive Manufacturing Company
summary:
In-space transportation startup The Exploration Company has acquired German additive manufacturing firm Thrustworks to expand its production capacity and unlock new commercial revenue streams. Founded in 2023, Thrustworks Additive Manufacturing produces high-performance metal components for space and defence applications. It offers end-to-end manufacturing capabilities, including design optimisation, printing, and post-processing. According to the company, it […]

title: ESA awards excellent suppliers
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) brings public and ESA-wide recognition of the outstanding performance of European companies working in the frame of ESA programmes and projects.

title: Smile approved for launch in spring 2026
summary: Smile has passed its qualification and flight acceptance review, meaning that it meets all requirements for launch. The launch window has been set for 8 April to 7 May 2026.

title: Reimagining space stations for the commercial age
summary:
In this episode of Space Minds, host Mike Gruss sits down with Marshall Smith, CEO of Starlab Space for a fireside chat at the Johns Hopkins University Bloomberg Center, the next installment of the Center’s Discovery Series.
